reg:regulation.reg:title: Advisory Committee on Veterinary Drugs Regulation

bcl:section.bcl:text: A committee called the Advisory Committee on Veterinary Drugs is established which shall consist of 5 members as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: one member nominated by the College of Pharmacists of British Columbia, who shall be the chairman of the committee;
one member nominated by the British Columbia Veterinary Medical Association;
2 members from the Ministry of Agriculture and Lands, one of whom shall be the secretary of the committee;
one member from the Ministry of Health.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The chairman may appoint sub-committees comprising members or non-members of the committee, and he shall designate the responsibilities and duties of each sub-committee.
The secretary shall keep proper minutes and record the proceedings of each meeting of the committee.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: make recommendations to the Minister of Agriculture and Lands

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: on the sufficiency of present legislation dealing with veterinary drugs, and
as to the enactment of new legislation or changes in existing legislation, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: carry out such investigations as may be requested by the Minister of Agriculture and Lands.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions of the Veterinary Drugs Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 363, relevant to the enactment of this regulation: section 71 (2) (k)]
